cookies.text:
What are cookies?

A cookie is a file that is downloaded when users access to some websites. Those cookies allow the website owner to obtain and store information about users' browsing habits. As, for instance: how many times the website has been visited by the user, the chance to identify the registered user, the possibility to guarantee the users' session while browsing the website, et cetera.

Advance Medical informs the user about the use of the following cookies:

Cookie's name: analytics.js.

Cookie's domain: www.google.analytics.com.

Expiration: Permanent.

Cookie's use: Functional.

The user may deactivate cookies in operation on this website at any time through the navigator configuration. Every navigator has different characteristics, so the user should consult the help menu in order to remove or modify the cookies.

What kind of cookies does this website use?

Technical cookies
Technical cookies allow the user to browse a website, platform or application, and use the different options or services that these provide, for example, control web traffic and data transfers, access restricted parts of the site, record the elements used in certain forms, make an online purchase, subscription, or event, use security features, and store the content of audio or video files shared through servers and social networks.

Personalization cookies
Personalization cookies allow users to access web services with certain predefined elements, established through a series of criteria on the user's computer; these may include language preferences, the type of browser used to access services, the regional configuration from where the service is accessed, etc.

Analytical cookies
Analytical cookies allow the website to track and analyze information on how users visit the various pages on the site. The data collected through this type of cookie is used to measure activity on the web page, application, or platform, and to construct user profiles for the visitors of said pages, applications, and platforms, in order to improve user experience, and allow for better service.

See the table below for more information on the cookies used on our website:

How can I disable or delete cookies?

You can choose to allow, block, or delete cookies installed in your computer by adjusting the settings of the web browser you use. But doing so might limit your ability to visit certain parts of the website or take advantage of some of our services.

For more information on how to manage cookies on the browser you use, please see the instructions below:

  • For more information on Internet Explorer click here.
  • For more information on Firefox click here.
  • For more information on Google Chrome click here.
  • For more information on Safari click here.
  • For more information on Opera click here.

disclaimer.title: Privacy Notice
disclaimer.text:
At Advance Medical we are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy.

This notice describes how personally identifiable information about you (the data subject) may be collected, used, and disclosed, and how you can get access to this information. Please review it carefully.

The data controller is Advance Medical S.A. with offices in 252 Via Augusta 08022 Barcelona Spain and its affiliates and subsidiaries.

Introduction

Advance Medical collects personal, medical data about and from individuals (data subjects) who have provided fully informed consent. Collected personal data is never shared for any purpose other than as defined in this notice and strictly for the purpose of rendering the Services for the benefit of the person identified by the data collected. Such data is permanently de-identified when the data subject is no longer eligible for the service.

Scope

Advance Medical operates globally and is committed to full compliance with all laws and regulations of any jurisdiction within which it operates. This particularly applies to all privacy laws and regulations.

Global policy, fundamental principles

Advance Medical's Privacy Policy complies with the general provisions and basic principles of the Madrid Resolution. (See: International Conference of Data Protection and Privacy Commissioners, Madrid, 5th November 2009):

  • Personal data must be processed lawfully and fairly
  • Limit private data usage to legitimate fulfilment of a specific purpose as defined by informed consent of the data subject.(Person the data is about)
  • Limit processing and storage to minimum necessary
  • Accurate and sufficient to consented purpose
  • Open, transparent privacy policies
  • Accountability for compliant privacy measures
  • Legitimacy: informed consent, adherence to law, easy path to withdraw consent.
  • Definition and protection of sensitive data
  • Third party privacy controls
  • International transfers must adhere to Madrid Resolution principles.
  • Data Subject's rights to concise, timely, comprehensive information regarding data about them and related processing and usage.
  • Data subject's right to rectification of data: incomplete, inaccurate, unnecessary or excessive.
  • Data subject's right to object subject to law and necessary processing.
  • Must implement procedures to support data subject's exercise of their rights.
  • Security Measures: Technical and procedural support for integrity, confidentiality and availability must be provided.
  • Maintain the confidentiality even after relationship to data subject has terminated.
  • Proactive measures: prevention, detection, organization, privacy/security officer, training, independent audits, privacy impact assessments, and policies and procedures.

The confidential information will be registered in a secure and proper manner following the General Data Protection Regulation (hereinafter GDPR) on the protection of individuals with regards to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data. You may request information, file a complaint and exercise your rights of access, rectification, suppression, limitation of treatment, portability and opposition to the Data Protection Officer: dpo@advance-medical.com, indicating your name, what service was used and your telephone number, and attaching your Identification Card or any other document that permits to identify you.

In order to better protect your data, we inform you that Advance Medical uses data centers based in the EU and in the USA that comply with all the privacy, security and contingency measures and regulations. With your acceptance you are also entering into an agreement for such matters with Advance Medical, Inc, a subsidiary of Advance Medical in the USA who owns the agreements with servers in the USA. By accepting these Terms and Conditions, you are agreeing to the international transfer of your personal data as stated above.

You should check whether it is lawful to access our services in the territory where you are. We provide our services in compliance with EU Data Protection laws and USA HIPPA regulations, and cannot take responsibility for any differences between those rules and any different rules applying to healthcare services anywhere else.

General Definitions

Binding Corporate Rules ("BCRs") are European Union (EU) defined templates for binding (enforceable) corporate policies that define how PHI/PII are to be handled.

Data Privacy Authorities (DPA) are the designated governmental agency in each EU country designated to deal with privacy issues.

Standard Contractual Clauses ("SCCs") are contract clauses between parties exporting and importing PHI/PII.

The term "data subject" and the term "you" mean the person identified by the data.

Advance Medical's contracts between exporting and importing entities implement SCCs wherever appropriate and feasible.

Advance Medical's corporate privacy policies while in compliance with privacy policy recommendation of the EU have not been reviewed by the relative Data Privacy Authorities. (DPA).

Advance Medical's Obligations

  • Maintain the privacy of data subject's personal data
  • Provide data subject with a notice as to our legal duties and privacy practices with respect to information we collect and maintain about the data subject
  • Abide by the terms of this notice
  • Notify data subject if we are unable to agree to a requested restriction
  • Accommodate reasonable requests data subject may have to communicate health information by alternative means or at alternative locations, or to correct data subject's information
  • Inform the data subject and address their rights related to personal data

Advance Medical's Definitions

  • Personally Identifiable Information (PII) is information or data that directly identifies an individual or that when used in combination with information available publically or to Advance Medical, may provide a high probability of identifying an individual.
  • Protected Healthcare Information (PHI) is PII that in addition contains health data about the individual identified by the data.
  • Data is constrained to be relevant and reliable for the purpose it was collected. Integrity and security controls are in place and monitored to maintain the accuracy of the data.

How data is used

  • Advance Medical uses and discloses PHI in creating a medical case history, identifying physician consultants, and producing Notes or Reports (the "Report").
  • Advance Medical does not share PHI, unless expressly consented by the Patient, for any purpose not both defined in this notice and required for the production of the Service and Report.
  • Examples of Disclosures for Treatment, Payment and Health Operations (TPO). Advance Medical may collect protected health information (PHI) for use in our Service (the "Service"). The information will be used and disclosed in creating a medical case and history, identifying physician consultants, and producing the Notes or Reports (the "Report"). Advance Medical may disclose your health information to case managers, clinical committee members, administrators who will use the information to process your case and other individuals who are involved in providing the Service or generating your Report. In some cases your information may be sent to an outside consulting physician or other consulting medical professionals. For example, a case manager may share your information with a medical director in order to identify an appropriate consulting physician for your case. The case manager may share the information with the consulting physician. We will ask these consultants to sign agreements requiring them to preserve the confidentiality of this information.
  • Other Uses of Data: Advance Medical also may use your health information to review or evaluate the performance of our systems in providing the Service to you and to improve the quality or timeliness of our services. Advance Medical also may create de-identified information based upon information you have provided to us. De-identified information is information that does not include your name, address, birth date, or other information that could be used to identify you. This de-identified information could be used for quality improvement, research and other purposes. For example, Advance Medical could use this de-identified information to demonstrate the reliability of our information management systems or to generate medical research information. We would not identify you by name or other personally identifying data in any resulting reports or other information. Advance Medical may disclose information in order to contact you during the course of providing services to you as either part of the ongoing process or as part of an effort to follow-up with you after using the Service or if there is an opportunity to inform you about additional services of interest. We may contact you through the mail, over e-mail or through the phone.
  • Online Activity Tracking and Advertising: We collect information about your activity on Our Systems through using technologies such as cookies, and server log files.
  • We do not use third-party cookies or non-Advance Medical web beacons i.e. Web based data collection by other than Advance Medical. I.E. we do not use advertising or tracking links. We use this automatically generated information to provide you with an optimal website experience. This includes measuring the effectiveness of our web pages and your interactions with them in order make using our pages as easy for you as possible.
  • Our site and related applications will generate log files tracking who has had access to your PHI and or PII.
  • Other Disclosures Mandated by Law: Advance Medical may be called upon to disclose PHI by a duly empowered branch of Government in any country in which our patients are a citizen.

Data Retention

  • Advance Medical retains PHI as long as it is required for the purpose of providing the Service to the individual identified by the PHI.
  • When the identified individual is no longer eligible for the Service, through specific request by the individual or other event that removes the individual from eligibility then the PHI is permanently de-identified in accordance with the GDPR on the protection of individuals with regards to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data. Any and all codes, links, or other data that could be used to relate the de-identified data to the identity of the individual are permanently destroyed.
  • Such permanently de-identified data is no longer PHI and is retained by Advance Medical indefinitely. Note that it is not possible to identify you from this de-identified data.

Notice

  • We will make our privacy commitments easy to find and easy to read.
  • Each individual about whom Advance Medical collects PHI or PII (the data) is ensured to be aware of what data we are collecting, the usage and purpose of the data collected, the individual's ability to control that usage and their rights related to that data, and the retention period of that collected data.
  • We will listen to your feedback and answer your questions about our Privacy Policy, commitments, and practices.
  • We reserve the right to change our practices and to make the new provisions effective for all PHI and PII we maintain. We will not use or disclose your health information without your authorization, except as described in this notice. If you have a question or would like a copy of this notice or would like additional information, you may contact us, details of our offices is located on our website in the contacts section http://www.advance-medical.net/contact. If you believe your privacy rights have been violated, you may file a complaint with Advance Medical, at dpo@advance-medical.com. There will be no retaliation for filing a complaint.

Choice

  • We do not share the data about you outside Advance Medical except as explicitly defined in this "Privacy Notice". Individuals have the option to opt out of the collection and forward transfer of the data to third parties, however this may preclude Advance Medical from rendering its services.

Your Health Information Rights

  • Request a restriction on certain uses and disclosures of your information.
  • Obtain a paper copy of this privacy notice (information practices) upon request.
  • You have the right to inspect, copy, and amend completed medical records maintained by Advance Medical (a fee may be applied).
  • Obtain an accounting of disclosures of your health information.
  • Revoke your authorization to use or disclose health information except to the extent that action has already been taken.
  • You have the right to request to receive confidential communications about your health information, such as having information sent to a particular address or in a particular way. In your request specify how you would like us to communicate with you. We may charge you a processing fee for these requests. In some cases we may not honor your requests, such as if disclosing records will cause you harm or if they are part of legal proceedings or if they are part of ongoing legal research.
  • You must include all of the specific information that you want changed, amended, or restricted and the person or categories of persons who should or should not have access to the information. We have the right to deny your requests or ask for additional information.
  • In the event that we deny your request you will be notified of any denial within 60 days and be given additional options or information.
  • We are only obligated to share disclosure accounting for the preceding six years. This accounting will not include disclosures made in the course of providing the Service or generating the Report, as described in this notice.
  • You have the right to make complaints about any possible violation of your Privacy Rights to Advance Medical. Advance Medical will not penalize you for making a complaint.
  • To inspect, modify or restrict your medical records please make a signed and dated written request to:
  • Privacy Officer
  • c/o
  • Advance Medical
  • EMEA office: Via Augusta 252 | 08017 BARCELONA | SPAIN | Tel. +34-932540010
  • dpo@advance-medical.com

Onward Transfer

  • We do not share PII or PHI with any third parties other than as required by the service and report production and documented in this notice. We insist that the vendors, including doctors under contract to Advance Medical that we retain to provide support services to Advance Medical, adhere to our Privacy Policy and Principles as well as all globally applicable data privacy laws.

Security Enforcement

  • We safeguard the data with tested and certified technical and manual security controls. We educate our employees and service providers on our Privacy Policy and Principles- as well as their roles and responsibilities in complying with them; and we enforce remedial penalties for non-compliance.

Global Compliance

  • We are committed to comply with the applicable data privacy laws in all regions where we have subsidiaries and affiliates.

Access

  • We strive to keep your Personal Information accurate and current; and we update or disclose it to you whenever you request us to do so. We post our Privacy Policy and Principles on our Web sites and we notify you about any significant amendments thereto. Individuals are able to access information held about them, and correct or delete it if it is inaccurate. Individuals are responsible for communicating modifications, rectifications or additions to their Personal Information in order that Advance Medical may change it accordingly and keep it current.
  • Access to Advance Medical sites are access controlled and restricted to registered adult patients, parents or guardians of minor patients, and our own staff of physicians, case managers and medical experts. Advance Medical has implemented manual and technical, physical and electronic security controls to best ensure that our systems and data are secure. These controls are continuously monitored and upgraded as required by changing business processes, new threats and as better security controls become available.

Payment Data

  • Advance Medical does not use PII or PHI for payments.

register.privacy.text:
At Teladoc Health UK LTD we are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy.

This privacy notice describes how Personal Identifiable Information (PII) and Personal Healthcare Information (PHI) about you may be collected, used, and disclosed, and how you can get access to this information. Please review it carefully.

The data controller is Teladoc Health UK LTD (hereinafter “Teladoc”) with offices in 68 King William Street, London EC4N 7DZ. Therefore, Teladoc will be the entity who will collect personal identifiable and personal protected health information.

Teladoc mainly collects your PII and PHI in order to provide you with the Service. We will never share your personal data for any purpose other than as defined in this Privacy Policy, but strictly for the purpose of rendering the Service for the benefit of the person identified by the data collected. We will permanently anonymise your personal data when you are no longer eligible for the Service.

1. Scope

Teladoc operates globally and is committed to full compliance with all applicable laws and regulations of any jurisdiction.

2. Fundamental Principles

Teladoc 's privacy practices comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 which include the following protections:

  • Your personal data will be processed lawfully, transparently and fairly
  • Limiting personal data use to a legitimate purpose
  • Limiting the processing and storage of your personal data to the minimum necessary
  • Making sure the privacy notice is accurate and sufficient
  • Maintaining open and transparent privacy policies
  • Being accountable to you for processing your personal data
  • Making sure your consent is informed and easy to withdraw.
  • Defining and protecting your sensitive/special categories of data
  • Ensuring third parties apply similar or equivalent standards of privacy controls where they process your personal data on our behalf
  • Not transferring your personal data outside of the EU and the USA unless otherwise required by law..
  • Giving you the right to concise, timely, comprehensive information regarding our processing of your personal data.
  • Giving you have the right to rectify incomplete, inaccurate, unnecessary or excessive personal data.
  • Giving you have the right to object (where applicable).
  • Making sure we have procedures to support your exercising of any data subject rights.
  • Applying security measures, including technical and procedural support for integrity, confidentiality and availability must be provided.
  • Maintaining the confidentiality of your personal data even after our relationship with you has terminated.

3. International Transfers

In order to better protect your data, Teladoc uses in the framework of the provision of the Second Medical Opinion, data centres based in the EU and in the USA, that comply with all the privacy, security and contingency measures and regulations.

In case it is necessary for the provision of the Service, Teladoc might transfer your data within the companies of the TELADOC HEALTH group (Spain -TELADOC HEALTH INTERNATIONAL, SA-, UUSS –Advance Medical Inc.-, Brazil – Advance Medical Serviços de Consultoria e Gestâo de Dados Lda-, Hungary –Advance Medical Hungary KFT-, Chile –Advance Medical-Health Care Management Services Chile, S.A.- and China –Advance Medical Health Care Management Consulting Shangai Co. Ltd.-).

Despite Brazil, Chile and China haven 't been considered as secure countries regarding Data Protection, Teladoc uses standard and centralised protocols as well as security measures in order to guarantee the privacy of your data, avoiding its distribution to third parties, regardless of the level of legal requirement that the recipient country has. Teladoc have agreements among its affiliates for legal compliance. You can ask for warranties that those agreements had been executed.

4. Contact Information & Data Protection Officer & Data Protection Authority

You may request information, file a complaint and exercise your rights data protection rights as set out below by emailing dataprotectionofficer@teladochealth.com , indicating your name, what service was used and your telephone number, and attaching your Identification Card or any other document that permits us to identify you.

  • Right of access: right to ask Teladoc for copies of your Personal Data.
  • Right to rectification - you have the right to ask Teladoc to rectify Personal Data you think is inaccurate. You also have the right to ask Teladoc to complete information you think is incomplete.
  • Right to withdraw Your consent at any time to the processing of Your Health Data
  • Right to erasure: right to ask Teladoc to erase your Personal Data in certain circumstances.
  • Right to restriction of processing: right to ask Teladoc to restrict the processing of your Personal Data in certain circumstances.
  • Right to object to processing: the right to object to the processing of your Personal Data in certain circumstances.
  • Right to data portability: the right to ask that Teladoc transfers the information you gave to another organisation, or to you, in certain circumstances.

If you have any questions or would like a copy of this Privacy Policy, or you believe your privacy rights have been violated, you may contact the Data Protection Officer at dataprotectionofficer@teladochealth.com . There will be no retaliation for filing any complaint or exercising any subject rights.

You may also address to the English Data Protection Authority (the Information Commissioner's Office - www.ico.org.uk- ) any query, claim or issue related to data protection.

5. What Data is Collected

  • Personal Identifiable Information (PII) is information or data that directly identifies you or when used in combination with information available publicly or in the possession of Teladoc, may provide a high probability of identifying you.
  • Personal Healthcare Information (PHI) is PII that in addition contains health data about the individual identified by the data.

6. How data is used

  • Teladoc collects and processes PII and PHI for the purposes of providing you with the Service, on the basis of and as necessary for the performance of the contract between you and us. With regard to the health data in particular, note that processing is necessary for the purposes of preventive or occupational medicine, medical diagnosis, the provision of health or social care or treatment, subject to the obligation of professional secrecy under Union or Member.
  • Teladoc does not share your PHI unless you expressly consent, for any purpose not both defined in this Privacy Policy and required for providing the Service.
  • Teladoc also may use your PII and/or PHI to review or evaluate the performance of our systems in providing the Service to you, and to improve the quality or timeliness of our service. Teladoc also may create de-identified information (anonymous data). De-identified information is information that does not include your name, address, birth date, or other information that could be used to identify you. This de-identified information could be used for quality improvement, research and other purposes. For example, Teladoc could use this de-identified information to demonstrate the reliability of our information management systems or to generate medical research information.

7. Disclosure of personal data

Teladoc does not share your PII and PHI unless you expressly consent, for any purpose not defined in this Privacy Policy or necessary for the provision of the Service.

However, Teladoc may be called upon to disclose information by a duly empowered branch of Government or Court in any country in which our patients are citizen, in order to comply with EU or Union Member 's legal obligations.

8. Data Retention

Teladoc will retain your PHI as long as it is needed for providing the Service to you and for the relevant statutory periods (including, for the avoidance of doubt, those in respect of any claims or disputes as may be brought by a user of the Service.

After that, and, in any case, when you are no longer eligible for the Service then your PII and PHI are securely destroyed or permanently de-identified in accordance with applicable laws. Any and all codes, links, or other data that could be used to relate the de-identified data to you are permanently destroyed.

Such permanently de-identified data is no longer PII or PHI and is retained by Teladoc indefinitely. Note that it is not possible to identify you from this de-identified data, and therefore data subject rights would not be applicable to this data.

We insist that the vendors, including doctors under contract to Teladoc that we retain to provide support services to Teladoc, adhere to our Privacy Policy and Principles as well as their roles and responsibilities in complying with them.

9. Security Enforcement

We safeguard your personal data with tested and certified technical and organisational security controls. We educate our staff and service providers on our Privacy Policy and principles as well as their roles and responsibilities in complying with them.

10. Access to and keeping up to date your personal data

We strive to keep your personal data accurate and current ; and we will update or disclose it to you whenever you request us to do so. You are responsible for communicating modifications, rectifications or additions to your personal information in order that Teladoc may change it accordingly and keep it current.

You are able to access information held about you and can correct or delete it if it is inaccurate.

11. Access to our services

Access to Teladoc sites are accesses controlled and restricted to registered adult patients, parents or guardians of minor patients ; and our own staff of Health Professionals. Teladoc has implemented manual and technical, physical and electronic security controls to best ensure that our systems and data are secure. These controls are continuously monitored and upgraded as required by changing business processes, new data security threats and as better security controls become available.

12. Payment Data

Teladoc does not use PII or PHI for payments.

register.legal.text:
1. These terms of service apply to the use of the electronic Portal/app. The purpose of the Portal/app is to make routine, non-emergency communication more convenient and to provide you with fast and secure access to our doctors. Please follow these guidelines and contact us if you have any questions.

2. In case of a medical emergency, do not use the Portal/app to communicate with us. Please dial 911 (or the equivalent local emergency number from the country you are in) and then contact your treating doctor.

3. By using the Portal/app and this site you confirm that you are older than 18 years of age. Parents can use the Portal/app for their children under 18 years of age, however, communication in the portal/app will be with the parent of the participant.

4. You agree not to use the Portal for any purpose other than to communicate with us about your case. You agree not to attempt to circumvent any security safeguard that we use to protect the security of our information systems.
5. Upon registering you will provide us with your preferred email address. If your eligibility is confirmed you will receive an e-mail with login credential to the Portal/app.

6. You will receive an email whenever you have scheduled an appointment through the Portal/app. The e-mail will not contain confidential health information, but will prompt you to sign into the Portal.

7. If you are representing someone else and choose to share any of their contact information with us, you must verify that you have express consent from that person to do so and we will do the same.

8. The Portal/app has safeguards that are intended to prevent unauthorized parties from being able to access or read messages while they are in transmission. However, keeping messages secure depends on two important factors. First, we need you to make sure we have your correct email address and you MUST inform us it ever changes, and second, you should keep unauthorized individuals from learning your Portal/app username and password. If you think someone has learned your password, you should notify us and then you should promptly go to the Portal/app and change it.

9. Messages and files sent and received through the Portal/app may be included in our records, but may be deleted in accordance with our records retention policy.

11. The operation of the Portal/app may be interrupted by problems with computer hardware or software, interruptions in internet services, computer viruses or other problems beyond our control. If you need to reach us and the Portal/app is not working, please call us through the phone number in the Contact Us section of the website.

12. Do not use your regular e-mail account to send us confidential information since regular e-mail is not secure. All electronic communication from you to Advance Medical should be through the Portal.

13. Any of our staff may read or reply to your messages or telephone messages.

14. These Terms of Service are subject to change without prior notice. We retain the right to modify, discontinue, or suspend the Portal/app service for any reason at any time.

conditions.text:
These Terms and Conditions (the Terms") will apply to the provision by Teladoc Health UK LTD (hereinafter "Teladoc or us") of We Care (hereinafter "the Service") to eligible members, defined as an employee of a Policyholder that includes the Services as defined within a services agreement between CLFIS (U.K) Limited ("Canada Life") and Teladoc) as well as their immediate family.

Please read these Terms carefully and make sure that you understand them.

You will be asked to agree these Terms before registering on the portal. By clicking "I AGREE" you are entering into a legally binding agreement with Teladoc and expressly accepting these Terms and the Privacy Policy.

Acceptance of these Terms is a condition of use for the Service.

We Care

The purpose of the Portal is to make routine, non-emergency communication more convenient and to provide you with fast and secure access to our health professionals.

In case of a medical emergency, do not use the Portal to communicate with us.
Please dial the relevant local emergency number for the country you are in, and then contact your treating doctor.

Service limitation/restrictions

The Portal has, by its own nature certain limitations/restrictions regarding the Service and does not replace face-to-face consultations with your treating doctor or primary healthcare practitioner, nor does it replace primary healthcare. Face-to face consultations are always essential in cases of medical emergencies and where physical examination/intervention is required.

You are responsible for providing the Healthcare Professionals with the information that they advise is required in order to provide you with the Service.

If following use of the Portal, you have doubts or concerns regarding the professional advice/service provided, or regarding your health and wellbeing, please seek further medical assistance in a regular face-to-face consultation.

As with any other healthcare service, no results can be guaranteed or assured.

Geographical restrictions

You should check whether you are entitled to access our services in the territory where you are. Teladoc makes no representation that the Service available through the App/Portal is appropriate, legal or available for use in all and any location.

Privacy

Teladoc provides its services in compliance with EU Data Protection laws. It does not, however, take responsibility for any differences between those rules and any different rules applying to healthcare services anywhere else.

Identity Checks and Authentication

a) Initial authentication: Performing a physical comparison by photo ID verification:

We partner with Onfido in order to perform this procedure. This only ever needs to be done once. Thereafter we will simply ask a combination of security question along with your contact details.

New Patient Registrations through our APP: our agent will simultaneously assign the case to our doctor and send the patient an email explaining the identity check process.

1) We will ask the patient to verify identity by taking a picture of their passport, driver license, NationalIdentity card, or residence permit and thereafter following a few short steps where they will take a "selfie" and the identity check will be complete.

If the photographic ID does not have the address, then we will ask for a further non-photographic document to confirm the patient address. This process should ordinarily only take a few minutes.

2) Security question for ongoing authentication. That is to say, you will not be asked to confirm identity for subsequent consultations, instead at the point of registration, we will ask you to choose a security question: Mother's Maiden Name, Name of first school, Town of birth for example. With this, and the usual data protection questions - our doctor will be able to proceed with all subsequent consultations.

If the patient is consulting on behalf of their child, we will ask for proof of parental responsibility before creating a unique file for the child. This will usually be a birth certificate of the child's passport with matching surnames as the parent.

b) Ongoing authentication:

1: Check credentials against eligibility data provided by the client - typically an insurer.

2: The first time a patient contacts our platform, as above, along with identification verification, they are requested to define some security questions.

3: Afterwards, whenever they are request a medical consultation, they are requested to provide - full name, date of birth, home address and provide a correct response to the security questions. This way we ensure we are talking to the correct person.

Audits are performed to ensure that the above-mentioned process is followed by listening to phone recordings and ensuring that the protocol is accurately being used.

Prescriptions

Subject to the applicable law, Health Professionals may issue prescription for medicines only when, in their professional judgement, it is in your best interest to receive the medicine, and always in accordance with the Teladoc Prescription Policy.

You agree that: (i) any prescriptions you acquire from a Health Professional are solely for your personal use

omc_pneumology.slogan: Provided by a team of medical specialists at Teladoc Health
omc_pneumology.description:
Access to a pulmonology specialist whenever you need it and wherever you are.

Our team will provide the best assistance for consultations related to respiratory diseases, such as asthma, pneumonia, those derived from smoking (COPD), pulmonary emphysema, obstructive sleep apnoea, lung cancer... In all these situations, if you have any doubts, you can get the attention you need from the comfort of your home, at work or while you are travelling.

You can ask any question and get an answer from a pulmonologist.

When necessary, you can also attach any additional medical information for our team to examine so we can get a more complete picture of your situation. For example, if you have a blood test, x-ray, photograph of the medication you are taking... you can attach it to your consultation and our medical team will evaluate it.

Get in touch with our specialists. Our aim will be to answer your questions related to your respiratory health.

omc_nutrition.title: Nutrition
omc_nutrition.slogan: Provided by a team of medical specialists at Teladoc Health
omc_nutrition.description:
Do you want to improve your diet but don’t know where to start? Are you tired of trying and failing to lose weight? Do you suffer from Irritable Bowel Syndrome and don’t know what to eat?

Our team of nutritionists are ready to speak to you. You can ask any nutrition-related questions and set the goals you would like to achieve with a specialist from our team.

They can help you with dietary recommendations if you suffer from food intolerances or allergies. Give advice on portion sizes, food combinations and healthy eating behaviours.

They can also assist with managing ongoing medical conditions, such as diabetes, high blood pressure and high cholesterol amongst others.

Our nutritionists will provide you with personalised meal suggestions based on your preferences, your dietary needs and your routine.

Get in touch with our team and improve your health today.

omc_burn_out_prevention.slogan: Provided by a team of medical specialists at Teladoc Health
omc_burn_out_prevention.description:
GP consultations enable you to discuss any non-emergency health related issues with our team of GPs from the comfort of your own home or wherever you are in the world.

This access to a GP has no geographical restrictions.

There are many situations in which you and your family may want to use this service - whether it's about acid reflux, knowing which holiday vaccinations to get or you're suffering with debilitating back pain. You can get medical advice, prescriptions (if within safe guidelines), further specialist referrals and much more from a team of GPs.

You can upload images, such as scans, test results or medical reports, which can form an important part of your consultation and the GP will review and discuss these in detail with you.

omc_mental_health_support.title: Mental Health Support
omc_mental_health_support.slogan: Provided by a team of medical specialists at Teladoc Health
omc_mental_health_support.description:
GP consultations enable you to discuss any non-emergency health related issues with our team of GPs from the comfort of your own home or wherever you are in the world.

This access to a GP has no geographical restrictions.

There are many situations in which you and your family may want to use this service - whether it's about acid reflux, knowing which holiday vaccinations to get or you're suffering with debilitating back pain. You can get medical advice, prescriptions (if within safe guidelines), further specialist referrals and much more from a team of GPs.

You can upload images, such as scans, test results or medical reports, which can form an important part of your consultation and the GP will review and discuss these in detail with you.
omc_mental_health_support.use_service.te: As an customer, you get unlimited access to this service at no additional cost. There is no limit to how often you can use this service.

omc_mental_health_support.steps.3.text: Ask as many questions as you need to and our doctor will provide professional medical advice. If needed, they will provide on-going treatment on how to improve your condition.

omc_diet_support.title: Diet Support
omc_diet_support.slogan: Provided by a team of medical specialists at Teladoc Health
omc_diet_support.description:
Do you want to improve your diet but don't know where to start? Are you tired of trying and failing to lose weight? Do you suffer from Irritable Bowel Syndrome and don't know what to eat?

Our team of nutritionists are ready to speak to you. You can ask any nutrition-related questions and set the goals you would like to achieve with a specialist from our team.

They can help you with dietary recommendations if you suffer from food intolerances or allergies. Give advice on portion sizes, food combinations and healthy eating behaviours.

They can also assist with managing ongoing medical conditions, such as diabetes, high blood pressure and high cholesterol amongst others.

Our nutritionists will provide you with personalised meal suggestions based on your preferences, your dietary needs and your routine.

Get in touch with our team and improve your health today.

omc_pediatric.title: Pediatric
omc_pediatric.slogan: Provided by a team of medical specialists at Teladoc Health
omc_pediatric.description:
Access to a pediatrician whenever you have a consultation and from anywhere. The Pediatric Consultation allows you to ask specific questions to a specialist.

Our pediatricians can help you in many situations: your child's fever won't go away, he has a cough that prevents him from sleeping, he's been more tired for days... and advise on non-urgent conditions. Get the care you need from the comfort of your home, at work or while traveling.

You will be able to ask any question related to your child/children's health and get an answer from a health professional.

When necessary, you can also attach any additional medical information so that our team can examine it and get a more complete picture of your situation. For example, if you have a blood test, x-ray, photograph of the medication you are taking... you can attach it to your consultation and our pediatric team will evaluate it.

Get in touch with our team of pediatricians. Our goal will be to answer your questions.

omc_traveler.home.title: Traveler
omc_traveler.home.text: Request a call back from a GP. GPs are on hand to support you with medical concerns, prescriptions or further specialist referrals.
omc_traveler.title: Traveler
omc_traveler.slogan: Provided by a team of medical specialists at Teladoc Health
omc_traveler.description:
Access to a team of doctors, experienced in travel medicine and tropical diseases, whenever you need it and wherever you are.

Our experts will provide you with the best assistance to help you prepare for your trip and will accompany you wherever you are. There are many situations in which this can be useful for you: do you want to know what vaccinations you need for your next trip, what precautions you should take at your destination, what to take in your travel kit? What considerations should you take into account if you are travelling with children...?

You can ask any question and get an answer from a doctor before, during and after your trip.

When necessary, you can also attach any additional medical information for our team to examine and get a more complete picture of your situation. For example, if you have a blood test, x-ray, photograph of the medication you are taking... you can attach it to your consultation and our medical team will evaluate it.

Get in touch with our specialists. Our aim will be to answer your questions related to your health when travelling.
omc_traveler.use_service.title: Who can use this service?
omc_traveler.use_service.text: As an customer, you get unlimited access to this service at no additional cost. There is no limit to how often you can use this service.
omc_traveler.how_works.title: How does it work?
omc_traveler.how_works.text: You can proceed to complete the form and a doctor will call you to provide medical assessment.
omc_traveler.steps.1.title: Fill in the form:
omc_traveler.steps.1.text: Provide a brief summary of your medical problem
omc_traveler.steps.2.title: Talk to a doctor
omc_traveler.steps.2.text: Once your request is submitted, a doctor will contact you via your preferred method.
omc_traveler.steps.3.title: Get answers to your medical questions
omc_traveler.steps.3.text: Ask as many questions as you need to and our doctor will provide professional medical advice. If needed, they will provide on-going treatment on how to improve your condition.
omc_traveler.banner.title: You can ask our doctors any questions about your health from the comfort of your own home.
omc_traveler.banner.text:
This is not an emergency service and below are examples of conditions we cannot treat. If you are feeling severely unwell, we advise you to contact your local emergency services.
What we don't treat: Chest pain, shortness of breath, severe abdominal pain, heavy bleeding, thoughts of suicide or self-harm, confusion, loss of consciousness, severe infection, severe pain, suspected stroke, seizures, pregnancy complications, high fever in unwell infant.

omc_digestive_system.title: Digestive System
omc_digestive_system.slogan: Provided by a team of medical specialists at Teladoc Health
omc_digestive_system.description:
Access to a doctor anytime, anywhere. The Digestive System Consultation allows you to ask any health-related question to a physician.

Our doctors can help you with many medical conditions and advise on non-urgent health conditions. Get the care you need in minutes from the comfort of your home, at work or while traveling.

You will be able to ask any health-related question and get an answer from a healthcare professional.

When necessary, you can also attach any additional medical information so that our team can examine it and get a more complete picture of your situation. For example, if you have a blood test, x-ray, photograph of the medication you are taking... You can attach it to your consultation and our team of doctors will evaluate it.

Get in touch with our team of doctors. Our goal will be to solve your health-related questions.
omc_digestive_system.use_service.title: Who can use this service?
omc_digestive_system.use_service.text: As an customer, you get unlimited access to this service at no additional cost. There is no limit to how often you can use this service.
omc_digestive_system.how_works.title: How does it work?
omc_digestive_system.how_works.text: You can proceed to complete the form and a doctor will call you to provide medical assessment.

omc_digestive_system.steps.2.title: Talk to a doctor

omc_digestive_system.steps.3.title: Get answers to your medical questions
omc_digestive_system.steps.3.text: Ask as many questions as you need to and our doctor will provide professional medical advice. If needed, they will provide on-going treatment on how to improve your condition.
omc_digestive_system.banner.title: You can ask our doctors any questions about your health from the comfort of your own home.
omc_digestive_system.banner.text:
This is not an emergency service and below are examples of conditions we cannot treat. If you are feeling severely unwell, we advise you to contact your local emergency services.
What we don't treat: Chest pain, shortness of breath, severe abdominal pain, heavy bleeding, thoughts of suicide or self-harm, confusion, loss of consciousness, severe infection, severe pain, suspected stroke, seizures, pregnancy complications, high fever in unwell infant.

omc_urology.description:
Access to a specialist in urology whenever you need it and from anywhere.

When faced with a urinary infection, incontinence, problems related to the prostate and bladder... the urologist is the specialist who can best help you. In these and other situations, if you have any doubts, you can get the care you need from the comfort of your home, at work or while travelling.

You can ask any question and get an answer from a urologist.

When necessary, you can also attach any additional medical information for our team to examine so we can get a more complete picture of your situation. For example, if you have a blood test, x-ray, photograph of the medication you are taking... you can attach it to your consultation and our medical team will evaluate it.

Get in touch with our urologists. Our aim will be to answer your questions related to this speciality.

omc_clinical_tests.description:
The Healthy Habits Test allows you to fill in a questionnaire and obtain a report on your state of health with personalized advice and an assessment of your cardiovascular risk.

Thanks to the Healthy Habits Test, designed by a medical team specialized in prevention, you will obtain information on your cardiovascular risk profile and other values related to your state of health, as well as personalized dietary measures and recommendations on your lifestyle to care for and improve your health.

In addition, the service includes the possibility of contacting a doctor from the team in case you need it.

omc_nurse.description:
Service in which you will be referred to a nurse, your Wellness Advisor, who will advise you regarding your health and guide you through the different services of the Wellness program.

The objective of the Wellness Coach is to help you identify your health needs and to accompany you so that you can improve your wellness goals.

Depending on your health condition, the nurse will recommend the most appropriate service(s) for your situation.

omc_dermatology.home.text: Request a call back from a GP. GPs are on hand to support you with medical concerns, prescriptions or further specialist referrals.
omc_dermatology.title: Dermatology
omc_dermatology.slogan: Provided by a team of medical specialists at Teladoc Health
omc_dermatology.description:
Access to a dermatologist whenever you have a consultation and from anywhere. The Dermatological Consultation allows you to ask specific questions to a specialist.

Our dermatologists can help you in many situations: skin problems due to the use of masks, dermatitis, eczema... and advise on non-urgent conditions. Get the care you need from the comfort of your home, at work or while traveling.

You can ask any gynecological health-related question and get an answer from a healthcare professional.

When necessary, you can also attach any additional medical information for our team to review and get a more complete picture of your situation. For example, if you have a blood test, x-ray, photograph of the medication you are taking... you can attach it to your consultation and our team of dermatologists will evaluate it.

Contact our team of dermatologists. Our goal will be to answer your questions.

omc_mental_health_program.home.text: Request a call back from a GP. GPs are on hand to program you with medical concerns, prescriptions or further specialist referrals. This service is available from 9:00h am to 19:00h pm.
omc_mental_health_program.title: Mental Health Program
omc_mental_health_program.slogan: Provided by a team of medical specialists at Advance Medical
omc_mental_health_program.description:
GP consultations enable you to discuss any non-emergency health related issues with our team of GPs from the comfort of your own home or wherever you are in the world.

This access to a GP has no geographical restrictions and is available Monday to Fridays from 9:00 am to 19:00 pm.

There are many situations in which you and your family may want to use this service - whether it’s about acid reflux, knowing which holiday vaccinations to get or you’re suffering with debilitating back pain. You can get medical advice, prescriptions (if within safe guidelines), further specialist referrals and much more from a team of UK-based registered GPs.

You can upload images, such as scans, test results or medical reports, which can form an important part of your consultation and the GP will review and discuss these in detail with you.

There’s no limit to how often you can use this service.

emo.home.title: Second Medical Opinion
emo.home.text: If you need a second opinion on a medical condition, this service gives you access to world leading experts who will assess your diagnosis and provide recommendations for treatment.
emo.title: Second Medical Opinion
emo.slogan: Provided by a team of world leading medical experts at Teladoc Health
emo.description:
If you need a second medical opinion on a complex condition or are struggling to obtain a diagnosis, the expert case management connects you with a Personal GP Case Manager. They'll discuss your concerns, review your current diagnosis and treatment plan and where required, a world leading expert will provide their recommendations.

Your GP Case Manager will be with you throughout the whole process, helping to shape the conversation that ensures you receive the most effective and appropriate recommendations. They can provide assistance with best next steps to improve your recovery or help you make a more informed decision about your proposed treatment plan. They're there to guide and support you for as long as you need.

The service is aimed at the evaluation of cases involving serious or complex diseases. The most frequent types of cases are: oncological (cancer), health problems requiring surgery, neurological diseases, serious paediatric diseases and rheumatological diseases, among others.
emo.use_service.title: Who can use this service?
emo.use_service.text: As an customer, you get unlimited access to this service at no additional cost. There is no limit to how often you can use this service.
emo.how_works.title: How does it work?
emo.how_works.text: You decide how you want us to contact you (phone or email) and complete the form. Your Personal GP Case Manager will then contact you to explain the process, which involves four steps:
emo.steps.1.title: Gathering your information:
emo.steps.1.text: From the moment you contact us, your Case Manager will start the process of gathering the necessary information about your case.
emo.steps.2.title: Review of Medical Records:
emo.steps.2.text: A Clinical Committee will perform an initial review of the medical records and other documents you provide.
emo.steps.3.title: Expert Selection:
emo.steps.3.text: The Clinical Committee will begin the process of selecting the most experienced international medical experts in the relevant pathology.
emo.steps.4.title: Case analysis:
emo.steps.4.text: Your Case Manager will send your case to the selected experts and maintain telephone contact in order to discuss the specifics of the case with you (and with your treating physician, if desired).
emo.banner.title: You can ask our doctors any questions about your health from the comfort of your own home.
emo.banner.text:
This is not an emergency service and below are examples of conditions we cannot treat. If you are feeling severely unwell, we advise you to contact your local emergency services.
What we don't treat: Chest pain, shortness of breath, severe abdominal pain, heavy bleeding, thoughts of suicide or self-harm, confusion, loss of consciousness, severe infection, severe pain, suspected stroke, seizures, pregnancy complications, high fever in unwell infant.
emo.questions.1: Do you have questions and concerns around your diagnosis or treatment plan?
emo.questions.2: Do you seek clarity about the best next steps to take to optimise your recovery?
emo.questions.3: Would you like to make a more informed decision about your planned treatment?

gfp.request.failed.992.title: Thank you very much for your interest!
gfp.request.failed.992.text:
Thank you for the interest shown in the Get Fit Programme. The Body Mass Index (BMI) indicates that you're in a situation that requires a face-to-face follow-up by an endocrine.

However, we will send you a suggestion of a low-calorie diet until you go to a specialist.

Remember you can contact us if you need it, doing a nutritional enquiry, or calling our phone {{phone}}.

gfp.program.4-week.title: Lose weight in 4 weeks (0-4 Kg)
gfp.program.4-week.text: You are doing the Get Fit Programme, periodically you will receive e-mails with the diets and exercises to do.
gfp.program.4-week.welcome.title: Welcome to the Get Fit Programme
gfp.program.4-week.welcome.text:
Welcome to the Get Fit Programme

To help and support you to reach your goal during these 4 weeks, we provide you with supporting material:

  • Weekly menu plan for the entire programme, with food equivalencies and examples of dishes. We encourage you to hang it on your fridge to have it always at hand
  • Workout routine for the entire programme, as physical activity is a necessary complement for weight loss
  • Ideas and meal suggestions so that sticking to the diet is more easy going and enjoyable.

You will receive more ideas throughout the programme.

These materials have been sent to the email address you provided on the registration process. Remember you can always download the supporting material by clicking on the button below.
gfp.program.4-week.follow-up.text: For a follow-up of your programme, please complete this brief questionnaire.
gfp.program.4-week.suggestion.text:
Additional ideas and meal suggestions are provided to you by email so that you can make tasty and balanced meals every day in an easier and more enjoyable way.

Reminder: you can also download the documents by clicking on the button below.
gfp.program.4-week.finish.text:
Congratulations!

You have completed the Get Fit Programm
gfp.program.4-week.reward.text: Thank you for answering the follow-up questionnaire. As promised, here is your prize!

id_verification.text.need_verification: To comply with medical regulations, we need to verify your identification.
photo_guidance.title: Photo upload guidance
photo_guidance.text:
By attaching photographs, you are providing your consent for us to receive and store these images, that you are aware they form part of your medical record and will be filed within the record for this reason. The GP(s) involved in your care have your consent to view the image(s) supplied to help diagnose and/or treat your condition or recommend referral. The images may also be shared with a specialist for further advice or as part of your referral.

Inappropriate photos - The following are types of photos which are inappropriate to share. If you have any doubt, please wait until you have consulted with a GP who will let you know if any photos may be useful or appropriate.

Please DO NOT share photos which show:

  • Identifiable features eg. full facial images, identifiable tattoos
  • Intimate or sensitive body areas eg. Breasts or Genitalia
  • Photos unrelated to the area(s) you are consulting about

You should NEVER share any images of intimate or sensitive areas of anyone under the age of 18 years.

omc_psychological.title: Psychological
omc_psychological.slogan: Provided by a team of medical specialists at Teladoc Health
omc_psychological.description:
Are you experiencing emotional symptoms like changes in mood, stress, erratic thinking, anxiety and feel like it’s time to do something about it?

Sometimes finding where to get help is one of the biggest hurdles. In times like these, our team of psychologists can guide you in the right direction and give you a better understanding of your mental health condition, the treatment you need, as well as helping you to navigate the health system.

When requesting a consultation, our specialists will assess your condition and then point you in the right direction for further support.

telehealth.banner.title: Video consultation
telehealth.description:
Video GP consultations enable you to discuss any non-emergency health related issues with our team of GPs from the comfort of your own home or wherever you are in the world via your laptop, smartphone or tablet.

This round-the-clock access to a GP has no geographical restrictions and is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year.

There are many situations in which you and your family may want to use this service – whether it’s about acid reflux, knowing which holiday vaccinations to get or you’re suffering with debilitating back pain. You can get medical advice, further specialist referrals and much more from a team of doctors.

You can upload images, such as scans, test results or medical reports, which can form an important part of your consultation and the doctor will review and discuss these in detail with you.

Accessing this service via the Virtual Medical Care app means you can book an appointment slot in seconds and connect via video-consultation with one of our GPs.
telehealth.how_works.text: Download the Virtual Medical Care app, register and schedule a video call with a doctor.
telehealth.how_works.title: How does it work?
telehealth.slogan: Provided by a team of medical specialists at Teladoc Health
telehealth.use_service.text:
To have access to Virtual Medical Care you need to be insured under an eligible AIG insurance policy.

You will get unlimited access to this service at no additional cost. However, you will be responsible for any cost associated with any medical treatment recommended by the service. You will also be responsible for the costs of any medicines prescribed via the prescription service.

This service does not require an insurance claim to be made and will not show on or impact your company’s claims record.

This is not an emergency service and below are examples of conditions we cannot treat. If you are feeling severely unwell, we advise you to contact your local emergency services.
What we don't treat: Chest pain, shortness of breath, severe abdominal pain, heavy bleeding, thoughts of suicide or self-harm, confusion, loss of consciousness, severe infection, severe pain, suspected stroke, seizures, pregnancy complications, high fever in unwell infant.

omc_dementia_support.description:
One-year program in which our specialists in psychology and nursing offer support and follow-up to people with signs of dementia and also to their caregivers. The support ranges from the initial medical assessment for the diagnosis of dementia to the accompaniment from a psychological and nursing point of view for both the patient and her caregiver. We provide the patient with occupational therapy tools and cognitive stimulation exercises, and the caregiver a complete approach to dementia and information to understand and live with a person who suffers from the disease.

For a whole year, you will have arranged follow-ups with specialists by video consultation or by phone, so that you can get the care you need from the comfort of your home or wherever you are.

Get in touch with our specialists and get the most appropriate care for dementia cases, both for the patient and the caregiver. Our goal will be to accompany you for a year and provide you with the help you need.

omc_chronics_light.description:
Access to a one-year program for chronic patients, led by a nurse who will become the reference person for those patients who suffer from a chronic disease (COPD, diabetes or cardiovascular disease) and who meet the conditions established by Generali in policy.

The nurse will carry out a personalized follow-up and will offer you techniques and advice to understand your disease and live with it in such a way that it has the least possible impact on your day-to-day life. For a whole year, you will be monitored as many times as your nurse determines according to the assessment of your situation and the needs that arise (decompensation...), from the comfort of your home.

Get in touch with our specialists and get the most appropriate care if you are a chronic patient. Our goal will be to accompany you for a year and provide you with the help you need.

omc_intake_gfp.description:
Have you activated the GFP? Now, one of our specialists, doctor or nutritionist, will advise you so that you can successfully follow your program. Once you activate the program, he or she will contact you by phone or video call (depending on your preference) so that, based on a simple questionnaire, he or she can identify first-hand your needs and goals and assign you the plan that best suits you.

Therefore, you will have a professional who will introduce you to your plan, to make it easier for you to follow the program from the beginning and, therefore, to obtain the results you are looking for. From here you can follow it with the menus, tables and exercise videos available in your GFP, and with the possibility of contacting a specialist if you need it during the program.

Get the attention you need with this service from the comfort of your home, at work or if you are traveling.

omc_ophthalmology.description:
Clear questions related to visual symptoms and ophthalmological treatments conveniently and quickly

Do you have questions about ophthalmological diseases and need clarification?
Would you like help with the interpretation of an ophthalmological examination?
Do you have an eye symptom and want to know what care you should take?

The Specialty of Ophthalmology is dedicated to maintaining healthy vision and diagnosing, treating and monitoring the different clinical conditions that can affect vision.

Our dedicated medical team will be able to support you in situations related to acute pathologies of the eye and eyelid such as conjunctivitis (one of the main causes of red eye) and dry eye.

You can also clarify your doubts about cataracts, glaucoma or other eye diseases, and receive the necessary advice before and after surgeries that you may have in this context.

You can send clinical reports to the medical team , exams/analyses and/or images for a better assessment of your clinical situation or to obtain support in their interpretation.

As part of the consultation, the ophthalmologist may, if necessary, send you, by SMS or email, medication prescription and/or exams. Not all ophthalmological conditions are likely to be diagnosed and treated by telemedicine. Our ophthalmologists will clarify what is best for you in each specific situation and, in case of clinical indication, a referral will be made for a face-to-face consultation.

omc_psycho_oncology.description:
The Psychooncology service helps you maintain your emotional well-being at all stages of the disease.

Do you need support in managing this diagnosis?

Would you like to have psychological follow-up at this stage?

Medicina Online offers you a dedicated team of psychologists who will be close to you and your family, so that you never feel alone throughout all the stages of the disease. Whenever possible, you will be followed by the same health professional to ensure continuity in the follow-up.

Your emotional well-being is important to be able to face this phase in the best possible way, achieve better results in treatments and be able to live everyday life with quality of life.

omc_oncology_nutrition.description:
With Oncological Nutrition you receive a personalized diet plan that will help you mitigate the side effects of treatments.

Do you have questions about proper nutrition throughout the different phases of treatment?

p>Would you like to have a nutritional follow-up on possible side effects of the therapy (loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting...)?

Medicina Online provides you with a team of Nutritionists with experience in oncological disease, who will develop , whenever possible, a personalized plan suited to your needs, also sharing suggestions for varied meals. Monitoring will always be done by the same Nutritionist.

Nutrition is essential to boost your well-being throughout the treatments, maintaining your strength and energy and mitigating the side effects of therapeutic.

omc_elder_program.description:
Access to specialists in eldercare whenever you need it and from anywhere.

Our specialists are here to guide you through the unique stages of life that come with aging. Whether you have questions about aging-related health concerns, memory issues, chronic conditions, or medication management, our team is here to help.

Get the care you need from the comfort of your home, at the senior center, or while traveling.

You can ask any question and get an answer from a specialist. Make an appointment for a video call or be called back at your convenience.

When necessary, you can also attach any additional medical information for our team to examine, allowing us to have a more comprehensive understanding of your health. Whether it's recent lab results, X-rays, or information about medications you are taking, our medical team will carefully evaluate it.

Get in touch with our specialists for any health-related questions specific to the elderly. Our goal is to provide you with the support and answers you need to ensure a healthy and fulfilling life as you age.

Hospital Discharge

Ensure a smooth transition from the hospital with our specialized discharge support, designed to provide comprehensive assistance during the transition to home or a post-acute care facility.

Our specialists are dedicated to guiding you through the discharge process and ensuring you have all the information and resources you need for a successful recovery. You can ask any questions related to your post-hospital care and receive personalized advice. Schedule a video call appointment or request a callback at your convenience.

When necessary, you can also provide any additional medical information, which will help our team create a tailored discharge plan based on your specific needs. Whether it's medication instructions, follow-up appointments, or home care requirements, our expert team will ensure you have a comprehensive plan in place.

Contact our specialists to address any concerns related to your hospital discharge. Our goal is to facilitate a seamless transition and support your journey towards a full and speedy recovery.

omc_parenting_advice.description:
Parenting Advice

Gain valuable insights into parenting, accessible from the comfort of your home, at parenting centers, or while on the go.

Our specialists are here to provide expert guidance and support in various aspects of parenting. You can ask any parenting-related questions and receive personalized advice. Schedule a video call appointment or request a callback at your convenience.

When necessary, you can also share any additional information about your parenting challenges or concerns, which will help our team better understand your situation. Our expert team will carefully assess your queries and offer tailored strategies for effective parenting.

Contact our specialists to address any parenting-related questions. Our goal is to equip you with the knowledge and tools needed to navigate the challenges of parenthood and foster a positive and nurturing environment for your children.

omc_pregnant_program.description:
Pregnancy Program

Receive the care you need from the comfort of your home, at the prenatal center, or while traveling.

You can ask any question and get an answer from a specialist. Schedule a video call appointment or request a callback at your convenience.

When necessary, you can also attach any additional medical information for our team to examine, allowing us to have a more comprehensive understanding of your health. Whether it's recent lab results, ultrasound images, or information about medications you are taking, our medical team will carefully evaluate it.

Get in touch with our specialists for any pregnancy-related questions. Our goal is to provide you with the support and answers you need to ensure a healthy and fulfilling pregnancy journey.

omc_stress_management.description:
Stress Management

Take control of stress with stress management consultations, accessible from the comfort of your home, workplace, or while on the go.

Our specialists are here to provide guidance and support in managing stress effectively. You can ask any questions and receive expert advice. Schedule a video call appointment or request a callback at your convenience.

When necessary, you can also share any additional information about your stress levels or triggers, which will help our team gain a better understanding of your situation. Our expert team will carefully evaluate your concerns and provide personalized strategies for stress reduction.

Contact our specialists to address any stress-related questions. Our goal is to equip you with the tools and techniques needed to manage stress and lead a more balanced and fulfilling life.

omc_confidant.description:
Access to a work confidant/coach when you need it.

Our specialist will help you manage those situations that arise in the work environment and that require a discreet and effective approach to be able to deal with them.

In these cases, a work confidant/coach will be at your side to accompany you and provide you with the necessary tools appropriate to your problem. A first step from which you can decide whether to refer you to an external coach for deeper and continued monitoring.

You can comment on your situation and get a response from our specialist. Get in touch with our work confidant to feel calmer and accompanied in the process.

dermatology_ai.home.title: Dermatology AI
dermatology_ai.home.text: Get a diagnosis based on the symptoms you provide and the analysis of this effective tool, as well as our doctor's evaluation.
dermatology_ai.title: Dermatology AI
dermatology_ai.description:
With this service, you can consult on all types of dermatological problems from the comfort of your home. To request a consultation, all you need to do is upload a photo of the troubling skin lesion. After completing a brief questionnaire, a doctor will evaluate your case using an Artificial Intelligence tool.

You will receive tailored recommendations for your situation without the need to travel.

omc_psycho_postnatal.description:
Motherhood is supposed to be one of the happiest and most beautiful moments in life, but not all women live it that way and some are overwhelmed by the situation and are not able to enjoy it as they should. To be at your side, we offer you the support of a team of specialized psychologists who will help you go through the emotions of this stage and will accompany you during this process of ups and downs.

A psychologist can identify what happens to us and provide us with tools to manage our emotions and help us live motherhood more fully.

omc_vegetarian.description:
Scientific evidence increasingly supports the greater presence of products of plant origin in our diet. It has been identified that populations with high or exclusive consumption of products of plant origin appear to be less likely to develop chronic diseases such as cardiovascular disease, certain types of cancer, diabetes and obesity. It is viable to implement a vegetarian dietary pattern, however it must be well oriented so that there are no nutritional deficiencies and that it is adapted to your specific needs.

I would like to implement this dietary pattern, but I don't know how to start? Do you already follow this eating pattern, but have never had professional support? Are you in the process of transitioning to a vegan standard and are unsure whether you can meet your nutritional needs? Consult a Nutritionist who can help with these questions and others related to this type of diet.

You can always attach a document to your file, namely your latest analyzes so that it can be used for the consultation.

This service is available from Monday to Friday, from 9am to 7pm, by appointment.

This is not an emergency service and below are examples of conditions we cannot treat. If you are feeling severely unwell, we advise you to contact your local emergency services.
What we don't treat: Chest pain, shortness of breath, severe abdominal pain, heavy bleeding, thoughts of suicide or self-harm, confusion, loss of consciousness, severe infection, severe pain, suspected stroke, seizures, pregnancy complications, high fever in unwell infant.

omc_weight_management.chat.request.text: Briefly explain the reason for your inquiry and a chat with a physician will be initiated.
omc_weight_management.description:
Modifying body composition can be a very challenging process and must be done in a balanced way with professional guidance. Excess weight and obesity can have negative health consequences and weight loss can produce clinically significant benefits on current and future health status. Changing your diet with the aim of losing weight does not necessarily mean eating less. But rather, ensure a regular food intake so that you can meet your daily nutritional needs (macro and micronutrients) for the body to function properly. And, at the same time, awareness of possible needs for improvement as well as the energy density of food.

Low weight and low levels of muscle mass can have consequences such as a feeling of tiredness, anemia, increasing the risk of hair loss, in the case of women changes in the menstrual cycle, among others. Although not all people who are underweight reveal the presence of these symptoms, it is important to ensure a body composition suitable for the correct functioning of the body.

Have you tried different diets without results? Would you like a professional opinion on a specific dietary pattern for your goals? Are you already making changes to your diet without results?

There are several ways to adapt your diet to your goals and in this consultation you can clarify all your doubts so that you can implement them into your daily routines.

This service is available from Monday to Friday, from 9am to 7pm, by appointment.

consultation.singapore.175.text: Due to local regulations, you need to be seen face to face by a local provider. We cannot support via telephonic or video consultations.
consultation.singapore.176.text: If you are currently located in Singapore, you need to request a Videoconsultation. Please book your consultation via your App/Portal. If it is an emergency, please go to your nearest Emergency Department.
consultation.singapore.177.text: Phone consultations are not available in Singapore - Please seek in-person care.  If it is an emergency, please go to your nearest Emergency Department.
